description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with open source researcher Connor Plunkett, about his report with Bellingcat titled "Kinahan Cartel: Wanted Narco Boss Exposes Whereabouts by Posting Google Reviews."
title: Investigative journalists track suspected cartel boss using his google reviews

description:
NATO, the alliance formed to protect Europe from the Soviet Union is marking 75 years. It the focus is still on Russia.

And a controversy in France over a singer selected to perform at the opening ceremony of the Olympics, raises questions about French identity.
title: A Milestone for a Major International Alliance and an Olympic Music Controversy

description: The former president's lawyers cited the Presidential Records Act in asking that the government's case be dismissed. Judge Aileen Cannon denied the motion — clearing the way for it to proceed.
title: Judge rules Trump's Mar-a-Lago classified documents case can proceed

description: A new exhibition and book honor the memory of the Pulitzer Prize-winning German photojournalist who was killed on April 4, 2014, while on assignment for The Associated Press in Afghanistan.
title: The work and legacy of photographer Anja Niedringhaus endure 10 years after her death

description: The organization had emerged earlier this year as a potentially well-funded force in the election. However, No Labels said Thursday that finding the right candidates proved difficult.
title: No Labels, which sought to challenge Biden and Trump, ends its 2024 presidential bid

description: The Guardian's reproductive health reporter Carter Sherman says efforts are underway in a number of states to assign fetuses "some kind of rights that we would generally ascribe to a human person."
title: Abortion opponents push for 'fetal personhood' laws, giving rights to embryos

description: Over 30 million people will be within the path of totality for Monday's solar eclipse as it crosses the U.S. from Texas to Maine. Here's what you need to know to safely enjoy the celestial spectacle.
title: What you need to know to watch Monday's total solar eclipse

description: President Biden spoke to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after seven aid workers with World Central Kitchen were killed in Israeli strikes. He said a ceasefire is needed so aid can get in.
title: Biden warns Netanyahu that U.S. policy on Gaza hinges on improved conditions there

description: Countries including Canada, the Netherlands and Spain say they're suspending arms sales to Israel. After an Israeli strike killed British World Central Kitchen workers in Gaza, will the U.K. too?
title: Why a majority of Britons want the U.K. to halt arms exports to Israel

description: Mayor Brandon Scott has come under attack as a "DEI" hire in the wake of the deadly bridge collapse.
title: Baltimore bridge's collapse is the target of anti-DEI rhetoric

description: Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott has been the target of racist attacks following last week's Key Bridge collapse.
title: Baltimore mayor faces racist attacks after bridge collapse

description: Professors and students at the University of South Florida mapped pitch, rhythm and duration to data about algae blooms and depletion of coral reefs to create an original composition.
title: A professor worried no one would read an algae study. So she had it put to music

description: The Chinook got shook when their truck got cooked. Now the salmon are swimming — but in the wrong brook.
title: Fish out of water story ends with 77,000 young salmon in the wrong water

description: Cases of bird flu have been found in dairy cattle, but the risk to humans remains low. Ukraine is front and center today as NATO celebrates its 75th anniversary.
title: How does avian flu affect your breakfast; NATO solemnly celebrates 75th anniversary

description: Russian attacks have driven out most of Chasiv Yar's residents. NPR accompanies the mayor on a routine visit to check on those who remain.
title: A mayor in Ukraine aids his town's few remaining people, as Russia closes in

description: The bill awaits action by the governor and would bar minors from getting married — something activists say leads to abuses.
title: Virginia lawmakers have voted to raise the marriage age to 18. Most states haven't

description: The Justice Department has taken an active — and public --stand against alleged Russian war crimes in Ukraine. But it's been nearly silent on possible war crimes in the Israel-Hamas war.
title: DOJ takes a stand against war crimes in Ukraine. In Gaza war, it's been nearly silent

description: Experts said if the Baltimore bridge had been outfitted with more robust collision-prevention structures, the collapse might have been avoided. Records indicate a lack of investment by the state.
title: Concrete structures meant to protect Baltimore bridge appear unchanged for decades

description: Despite a law mandating that they offer the pills, many campus health clinics don't publicize that they have them, leaving students struggling to track them down off-campus.
title: California colleges provide abortion pills but many fail to make students aware

description: The day after what was the worst quake to hit the Asian island in a quarter century, most residents cannot stop talking about how much worse it could have been.
title: Taiwan emerges remarkably unscathed after massive earthquake

description: Cattle are getting sick with H5N1, and one person got sick in Texas. How bad could this be for dairy farms? Could it spread among people? Here's what scientists are learning.
title: What to know about the risks of the bird flu outbreak

description: Sam and John Fetters are identical twins with autism. But Sam is in college, while John still struggles to form sentences. Their experience may shed light on the disorder's mix of nature and nurture.
title: These twin brothers are identical, but their autism isn't

description: The jackpot, which now ranks as the eighth-largest in U.S. lottery history, has been growing for more than three months, reflecting the long odds of 1 in 292.2 million of winning the top prize.
title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $1.23 billion after another drawing without a big winner

description: The AWS layoffs follow other layoffs that happened at Amazon and its subsidiaries this year, including at Prime Video, the MGM Studios unit and Twitch, the social media platform owned by Amazon.
title: Amazon is cutting hundreds of jobs in its cloud computing unit AWS
